channel.title: Config error guile-2.0 not found, but it IS installed
channel.description:
Hello, Whonix Forums. I am fairly new to linux, but pick up on things pretty fast.
I'm running Whonix GNU/Linux 8.7 (jessie) trying to install Freetalk4-1. When running ./configure it's just one thing after another I have to install. Well now it's saying GUILE is not found, but in the pastebin below you can see it IS installed. I've tried rebooting completely multiple times and installed version 1.8 as well. I'm completely stumped.
https://pastebin.com/HdRuy4x1 <-----------------------------

item.title: Config error guile-2.0 not found, but it IS installed
item.dc:creator: activation
item.description:
Solved. Had to manually install from source.

Read full topic
item.source: Config error guile-2.0 not found, but it IS installed

item.title: Config error guile-2.0 not found, but it IS installed
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
This is most likely not caused by Whonix and would happen as well on Debian. Please try that. If so, please sort it out as per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Free_Support_Principle.

Read full topic
item.source: Config error guile-2.0 not found, but it IS installed
